description: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast. It is hosted by Ira Glass, produced in collaboration with Chicago Public Media, delivered to stations by PRX The Public Radio Exchange, and has won all of the major broadcasting awards.

items.content: The one thing you know for sure when you're watching a romantic comedy is that it's going to turn out okay in the end. When you're living one? Not so much. This week, stories that unfold like rom-coms.
items.contentSnippet: The one thing you know for sure when you're watching a romantic comedy is that it's going to turn out okay in the end. When you're living one? Not so much. This week, stories that unfold like rom-coms.
items.creator: This American Life

itunes.author: This American Life
itunes.subtitle: Stories about surviving the mishaps of love.

items.title: 770: My Lying Eyes

items.content: A man finds himself thrust into a new world he didn’t necessarily ask to visit. He takes a look around.

items.title: 768: The Other Front Lines

items.content: In this moment when autocrats and almost-autocrats are getting bolder and more powerful, we bring you two stories of resistance, from Hungary and Russia.

items.title: 767: Do Not Go Gentle

items.title: 764: School's Out Forever

items.content: Stories about Vladimir Putin. Did he come to power in 1999 by killing hundreds of innocent Russians? How’s he really seen in his home country? This show is a mix of old and new stories we’ve done about him.
